nodes.bodyText: Can you get rid of 4.0.9? Check if used anywhere.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -72,6 +72,7 @@ com.sun.xml.ws:jaxws-rt:2.2.10

nodes.bodyText: Missing other parameters.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -54,30 +61,57 @@
      * @param bases The base entries to create for this in-memory LDAP server.

nodes.bodyText: keystorePIN seems like it should be keystorePassword....
I would also put the bases parameter first so it matches the default constructor, it is the other parameters that are optional.

It seems to me that the only difference between when SSL is enabled or not is the listener configs. No need to reproduce the other code. Additionally, seems like we should enable both when SSL is enabled. Given the "setListenerConfigs" method name, seems like you can pass in multiple listener configs (LDAP and LDAPS)?
Instead of TLSV1.3, can we pass in a generic TLS (or something similar) that covers any valid TLS version? Then we don't have to come fix this when v4 comes out.
Might even consider always enabling LDAP and LDAPS....
that would remove the need to change the constructor.
Shouldn't have both. Remove 4.0.9.

nodes.bodyText: I would expect we copy the AD.ldif file here as well.

Documentation hasn't been updated for new class. I would explain that this class was created to contain the same data as the Active Directory instance of the ApacheDS stand-alone LDAP servers. This instance wasn't designed to behave like Active Directory.
I expected this class to extend InMemoryLDAPServer, and therefore not have to reimplement all the code.

When you extend from InMemoryLDAPServer, I would re-factor some of this. Really, the difference between the classes is the schema that gets loaded. So you could have the parent-class have a constructor that you can call with the schema that you want to load.
Why have this if it is commented out? I assume you will want this when you have the new class extend this class.
Why did you add this? Not sure we want JUnit assertions in here.

In general for this class, I wouldn't have expected so many changes. I can't be sure that you didn't change the test. Methods have been moved around, etc.
I guess I would expect that the difference would be in the general setup of the LDAP and Liberty server (to dynamically configure the LDAP connection). Most everything else should remain the same. Renaming fields just makes it harder to determine what you really changed.
keystorePassword please. I am not sure why UnboundID uses pin, but it is not standard phrasing.
put this in the finally
remove commented out code.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                http:\\www.eclipse.org\legal\epl-v10.html
          
          
            
                http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html

nodes.bodyText: Update copyright date above.
Update documentation to reflect the method.

We are changing these all over, but I wonder if we wouldn't be better suited to just include the JAR in the com.ibm.ws.com.unboundid artifact JAR, then we wouldn't ever need to update these again when we need to update to a newer version.
You can use the "Include-Resource:" directive in the BND file and it will include the resource in the generated JAR. For example:
Include-Resource: \
    @${com.unboundid:unboundid-ldapsdk;4.0.14;EXACT}

We are changing these all over, but I wonder if we wouldn't be better suited to just include the JAR in the com.ibm.ws.com.unboundid artifact JAR, then we wouldn't ever need to update these again when we need to update to a newer version.
You can use the "Include-Resource:" directive in the BND file and it will include the resource in the generated JAR. For example:
Include-Resource: \
    @${com.unboundid:unboundid-ldapsdk;4.0.14;EXACT}
